title: Provides a tax credit for the purchase of a programmable thermostat
summary: Provides a tax credit for the purchase of a programmable thermostat; defines "programmable thermostat" to mean a device attached to the heating and cooling system of a residence designed to automatically adjust the temperature to conserve energy; such credit shall be in the amount of fifteen dollars or less.

       Introduced by M. of A. JAFFEE, CAHILL, SPANO -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M.
         of  A.  COLTON, DINOWITZ -- read once and referred to the Committee on
         Ways and Means

       AN ACT to amend the tax law,  in  relation  to  a  tax  credit  for  the
         purchase of a programmable thermostat

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 606 of the tax law  is  amended  by  adding  a  new
    2  subsection (ss) to read as follows:
    3    (SS)  PROGRAMMABLE THERMOSTAT CREDIT. (1) AN INDIVIDUAL TAXPAYER SHALL
    4  BE ALLOWED A CREDIT AGAINST THE TAX IMPOSED  BY  THIS  ARTICLE  FOR  THE
    5  PURCHASE  OF  A  PROGRAMMABLE  THERMOSTAT DURING THE TAXABLE YEAR.  THIS
    6  CREDIT FOR ANY TAXABLE YEAR SHALL NOT EXCEED FIFTEEN DOLLARS.
    7    (2) FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE TERM  "PROGRAMMABLE  THERMO-
    8  STAT"  SHALL MEAN A DEVICE ATTACHED TO THE HEATING AND COOLING SYSTEM OF
    9  A RESIDENCE DESIGNED TO AUTOMATICALLY ADJUST THE TEMPERATURE TO CONSERVE
   10  ENERGY.
   11    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply to taxable
   12  years commencing on and after such date.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05548-01-1
